TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Section extends System.Windows.Documents.Block

Docs.summary: A block-level flow content element used for grouping other <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Block"> elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks **Content Model:** Section enforces a strong content model for child content. Child elements contained in a Section element must be derived from <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Block>. Valid child elements include:
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph>
- Section
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Table>
See [TextElement Content Model Overview](../Topic/TextElement%20Content%20Model%20Overview.md) for more information on the Section object model.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new, empty instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Section"> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Documents.Block block) cil managed

Docs.param: A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Block"> object specifying the initial contents of the new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Section>.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Section"> class, taking a specified <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Block> object as the initial contents of the new <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Section">.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates usage of this constructor.
[!code-cs[SpanSnippets#_Section_Const1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#_section_const1)] [!code-vb[SpanSnippets#_Section_Const1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/spansnippets/window1.xaml.vb#_section_const1)]

Docs.summary: Gets a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.BlockCollection"> containing the top-level <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Block> elements that comprise the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Section>.
Docs.value:
A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.BlockCollection"> containing the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Block> elements that comprise the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Section>
This property has no default value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.BlockCollection> returned by this property to enumerate or manipulate the contents of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Section> element.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether or not a trailing paragraph break should be inserted after the last paragraph when placing the contents of a root <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Section"> element on the clipboard.
Docs.value: **true** to indicate that a trailing paragraph break should be included; otherwise, **false**.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is only applicable to the root <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Section> element within flow content. This property has no effect on non-root <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Section> elements contained within flow content.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ShouldSerializeBlocks(class System.Windows.Markup.XamlDesignerSerializationManager manager) cil managed

Docs.param: A serialization service manager object for this object.
Docs.summary: This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](../../add/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.returns: `true` if the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Section.Blocks%2A> property should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
